articles.title: Can quantum computing tech kill fraud? The UK government thinks so, but with £100 million, I'm not so sure
articles.description: Will the government’s £121 million investment change the landscape?
articles.content:
The UK Government has announced a £121 million investment into quantum technologies, a move it says will help “tackle fraud, prevent money laundering, and drive growth”.

articles.title: ‘Fed up’ Gayle King boarding Blue Origin flight to space becomes instant meme
articles.description: Gayle King has become an instant meme on social media after boarding the Blue Origin flight to space alongside Katy Perry - but seemingly being absolutely terrified before they set off. The all-female crew rung a bell as they boarded the capsule, but Gayle King was less-than-enthusiastic about her turn.
articles.content:
Katy Perry, Lauren Sanchez, Gayle King, Aisha Bowe, Amanda Nguyen, and Kerianne Flynn have all successfully made it back from space after going up on Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin flight.
The crew of six blasted off from Blue Origin’s launchpad in Texas an... [1621 chars]

articles.title: Politics latest: Supplies to keep British Steel burning set to arrive - China could stay involved, says minister
articles.description: Trade minister Sarah Jones told Sky News that people at the Scunthorpe steelworks are "reassured" they have what they need to keep the blast furnaces running. Watch live as the raw material is unloaded.
articles.content:
Minister doesn't rule out working with Chinese partner in Steel industry again

articles.description: Under the Engine Idling Law, which forms part of Rule 123 of the Highway Code, drivers must not leave a vehicle's engine running unnecessarily while stationary on a public road.
